page.title: 16Local Sustenance
page.content: The Devonshire Arms Hotel: Built in l82O as a shooting lodge, it has served as an auction room as well as public house and coaching station. Death duties in l9l8 caused the sale of this and many other properties of the Devonshire family. The Village Shop: Originally a C.W.S. property, it is now in private hands. It serves both parishes in the area, and offers P.O. facilities. The Crown Inn, Long Load: Originally the Wheelwrights Arms, it served the river workers, both on and off the water. It was situated next to the stabling and landing stages, on the Load side of the River Yeo.
